org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive

Class PathServo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.robots.differentialdrive.PathServo

  • public class PathServo
extends Object
    This class represents a control servo which acts to keep an object traveling in the direction of the given target point and traveling at an appropriate speed toward it. Any deviations from the path will be corrected.
    Author:
    jona

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PathServo(double aMaxMovementSpeed, double aDistanceTolerance, double aAngleTolerance, double aDecelerationDistance, IServo aSpeedServo, IServo aDirectionServo, IGoalReachedListener aGoalReachedListener)
      The constructor creates a new path following servo object with the given maximum speed and turn speed in order to place a bound on the speed at which the object will attempt to move.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PathServo

        public PathServo(double aMaxMovementSpeed,
         double aDistanceTolerance,
         double aAngleTolerance,
         double aDecelerationDistance,
         IServo aSpeedServo,
         IServo aDirectionServo,
         IGoalReachedListener aGoalReachedListener)
        The constructor creates a new path following servo object with the given maximum speed and turn speed in order to place a bound on the speed at which the object will attempt to move.
        Parameters:
        aMaxMovementSpeed - The maximum speed of the object in m/s.
        aDistanceTolerance - The distance (in meters) at which we decide we are close enough to our goal to consider that we have reached it.
        aAngleTolerance - The angle at which we decide we are close enough to our goal.
        aDecelerationDistance - The distance at which we should begin to slow down before reaching the goal.
        aGoalReachedListener - This is a listener which will be called when the goal has been reached and we are ready to traverse to a new goal.

    • Method Detail

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination(Vector2 aDestination,
                  double aDestinationDirection)
        This method sets the destination of the path controller and indicates the speed at which the object should be traveling when the destination is reached.
        Parameters:
        aDestination - The point the object will be traveling toward in meters based on a stationary coordinate system.
        aDestinationDirection - The direction the object should be facing when it reaches the destination as measured in radians.

      • setCurrentPosition

        public void setCurrentPosition(Vector2 aCurrentPosition,
                      double aCurrentDirection)
        This method sets the current position of the object so that the direction and speed it should move in order to reach the destination can be calculated.
        Parameters:
        aCurrentPosition - The current position of the object in meters based on a stationary coordinate reference.
        aCurrentDirection - The direction the object is currently facing as as measured in radians.
